ca.cs.ualberta.localpost.controller

Class Serialize

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cs.ualberta.localpost.controller.Serialize

  • public class Serialize
extends java.lang.Object
    Serialize an Object for caching purposes
    Author:
    Team Radish

      • SaveComment

        public static void SaveComment(CommentModel new_root,
               android.content.Context context,
               java.lang.String parentid)
        This function takes comment model and turns it into a Json string
        Parameters:
        new_root - comment model that will be saved in file
        context - takes in the activities context
        parentid - helps determine which file to save in

      • SaveUser

        public static void SaveUser(StandardUserModel user,
            android.content.Context context)
        Takes in a user profile and saves it in memory for later re use
        Parameters:
        user - is the user profile that is to be saved
        context - is the activitie's context

      • write

        public static void write(java.lang.String modelJson,
         android.content.Context context)
        Takes a CommentModel in a Json string and writes it to the filename that was specified while appending it
        Parameters:
        modelJson - is the data that needs to be saved
        context - is the activitie's context

      • writeuser

        public static void writeuser(java.lang.String modelJson,
             android.content.Context context)
        Takes a UserProfile Json string and writes it to the filename that was specified while overwriting previous profile information
        Parameters:
        modelJson - is the data that needs to be saved
        context - is the activitie's context

      • check_if_exist

        public static void check_if_exist(java.lang.String file,
                  android.content.Context context)
        This function checks for the existance of "file" and deletes it for the sake of creating a new cache instead of appending an infinite amount of cache
        Parameters:
        file - is the file to save to
        context - is the activity's context

      • update

        public static void update(CommentModel updatedroot,
          android.content.Context context,
          java.lang.String file)
        This function goes through a file and updates cached comments so they match in terms of children, radish etc with the one that is saved to elastic search It also deletes the old one after retrieving the comments from it before saving it into a new cache
        Parameters:
        updatedroot - the comment that needs to be updated
        context - the activity's context for io purposes
        file - the file the comment is being updated in.

      • loadFromFile

        public static java.util.ArrayList<CommentModel> loadFromFile(java.lang.String filename,
                                             android.content.Context context)
        Load GSON objects from a file, deserialize them and pass them to an ArrayList as RootCommentModels. Depending on the filename it will load from different caches
        Parameters:
        filename - file containing all serialized GSON objects that we saved
        context - activity's context
        Returns:
        arraylist of RootCommentModels

      • loadchildFromFile

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,ChildCommentModel> loadchildFromFile(java.lang.String filename,
                                                                      android.content.Context context)
        Loads children from cache files and inserts them into a hashmap. This hashmap can be accessed at constant time hence why it is used
        Parameters:
        filename - is the filename to load from
        context - is the activity's context for io purposes
        Returns:
        A thread in the form of a hashmap

      • loaduser

        public static StandardUserModel loaduser(android.content.Context context)
                                  throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                         java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                         java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        This function simply loads a user profile from the user profile cache
        Parameters:
        context - is the activity's context for io purposes
        Returns:
        The user's userprofile
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
